dcterms:creator: O. Monga
P. Garnier
V. Pot
E. Coucheney
N. Nunan
W. Otten
C. Chenu
dcterms:description: This dataset consists of sandy loam soil from the Bullion Field, an experimental site at the James Hutton Institute in Invergowrie, Scotland. The soil composition is 71% sand, 19% silt, and 10% clay by mass. The dataset includes 3D CT images with a resolution of 24μm, resulting in 22,720,090 voxels representing 17% of the total volume.
dcterms:title: Sandy Loam Soil

W. Otten
C. Chenu
dcterms:description: This dataset consists of quartz sand from the Fontainebleau forest, with two CT images corresponding to high and low porosity. The images have a resolution of 4.5μm and a size of 512 × 512 × 512.
dcterms:title: Fontainebleau Quartz High Porosity

dcterms:title: Fontainebleau Quartz Low Porosity

dcterms:creator: Olivier Monga
Frédéric Hecht
Mouad Klai
Bruno Mbe
Jorge Dias
Patricia Garnier
Valérie Pot
dcterms:description: This dataset includes sandy loam soil used for numerical simulations of transformation-diffusion processes in complex volume geometric shapes, specifically focusing on microbial decomposition of organic matter.
dcterms:title: Sandy Loam Soil (from Monga et al. 2022)

dcterms:creator: B. Mbe
O. Monga
V. Pot
W. Otten
P. Baveye
X. Raynaud
F. Hecht
N. Nunan
C. Chenu
P. Garnier
dcterms:description: This dataset includes sandy loam soil used for scenario modeling of carbon mineralization in 3D soil structure, comparing geometrical models and lattice Boltzmann approaches.
dcterms:title: Sandy Loam Soil (from Mbe et al. 2022)
